comment.author: 66406516@N08
comment._content: The U.S.S. Onondaga was commissioned on March 24, 1864 and served with the James River flotilla until the war's end. The ship was decommissioned on June 8, 1865. Sold to France in 1867, it continued in service until 1904 when it was sold for scrap. Her armament consisted of two 15-inch Dahlgren smoothbores and two 150-pounder Parrott rifles.
